ETYMOLOGY: From Old English alswā ('also, just as, equally'), a contraction of eall ('all') + swā ('so').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: conjunction: connects words, phrases, or clauses
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used to indicate that something happens in the same way or manner as something else; in the way that.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Do as you were told and you will succeed.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 按照别人告诉你的去做，你就会成功。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: conjunction: connects words, phrases, or clauses
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used to give the reason for something; because or since.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: As the roads were closed due to snow, we postponed the trip.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 由于道路因下雪关闭了，我们推迟了旅行。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: conjunction: connects words, phrases, or clauses
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used to indicate that something happens while or at the same time as something else.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He sang quietly as he worked.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他一边工作一边轻轻地唱歌。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: preposition: links nouns to other words
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: In the role, capacity, or function of.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She was hired as a project manager.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adverb: modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used before an adjective or adverb to indicate equality or similarity in extent.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The dog runs as fast as the cat.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这只狗跑得和猫一样快。
